WorkItem.Description:
I've noticed this problem since I started using Rawr with b13:
 
When on my work computer, any Rawr dialogs (item editing, optimizer, etc.) get cropped off at the bottom of the dialog window, obscuring the buttons (see attached pic). This doesn't happen on my home computer.
 
The specs on my work computer are as follows:
 
• Dell Precision 390
• Intel Core2 Duo E6400
• 2GB RAM
• ATI FireGL V3400 running Dual 20" Dell LCDs @ 1600x1200 (each)
• Windows XP Profession w/SP 2

Comments.Message:
You're using a high DPI screen setting, which has broken support in winforms. You can fix that by going to Display Options > Advanced > DPI, and setting it back to normal.

I've made some changes to try to improve how it looks for users on high DPIs, but it's still annoying and imperfect.

If you mean within my video card properties, it is set to normal: "Normal size (96 DPI)". The only other options are "Large size (120 DPI)" and "Custom setting...".

What's odd is that I have a pair of Samsung 19" Widescreen displays on my home PC, running at 1680x1050, and they don't have this problem.
Odd, do you have any sort of 3rd party interface adjustments? I've only ever seen stuff being cropped off like that with >96 DPI.

Not that I know of. They set the systems at work up fairly minimally, so as far as I can tell the only thing is the ATI drivers for the card itself.

I do have UltraMon installed (a multi-monitor manager - http://www.realtimesoft.com), but I'm running that at home as well.
Have you tried the latest Rawr?  I haven't seen this happen with recent versions.
